title: Elven dagger
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Elven_dagger/zh-CN "Elven dagger/zh-CN")

| ) [![Elven dagger.png](/images/3/3a/Elven_dagger.png)](/wiki/File:Elven_dagger.png) |                                                        |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------ |
| Name                                                                                | elven dagger                                           |
| Appearance                                                                          | runed dagger                                           |
| Damage vs. small                                                                    | 1d5                                                    |
| Damage vs. large                                                                    | 1d3                                                    |
| To-hit bonus                                                                        | +2                                                     |
| Weapon skill                                                                        | [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")                        |
| Size                                                                                | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")            |
| Base price                                                                          | 4 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight                                                                              | [10](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                            |
| Material                                                                            | [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood")                              |

An **elven dagger** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It uses the [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"), and like a dagger it can be used in [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") and [thrown](/wiki/Thrown "Thrown") as a [projectile](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile"). It is made of [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood"), and appears as a **runed dagger** when [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification").

[Sting](/wiki/Sting "Sting") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") elven dagger, and can be created by [naming](/wiki/Naming "Naming") any elven dagger "Sting".

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [4.4 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Player [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(starting_race\) "Elf (starting race)") start the game with knowledge of the elven dagger.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Elven [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") start each game with a +1 elven dagger as their secondary weapon.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

Elven daggers constitute 1.0% of randomly-generated weapons in the dungeon. In addition to random generation, weapon [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and general stores can stock elven daggers.

Live [elves](/wiki/Elf_\(monster_attribute\) "Elf (monster attribute)") have a 1⁄2 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an elven dagger.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4) [Hobbits](/wiki/Hobbit "Hobbit") have a 1⁄3 chance of generating with an elven dagger.[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)

[Player monsters](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster"), including those on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane"), have a chance slightly higher than 1% of generating with an elven dagger as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) Player monster [rangers](/wiki/Ranger_\(player_monster\) "Ranger (player monster)") have a 1⁄2 chance of their initial weapon being made into an elven dagger.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7)

## Strategy

Elven daggers are the best type of dagger available, but are somewhat harder to come by in comparison to normal daggers. A stack of elven daggers may be preferable to standard daggers, since they are only susceptible to rotting and fire damage - even this can be avoided by using a different weapon against the few monsters with fiery [passive attacks](/wiki/Passive_attack "Passive attack") (since no monster with a passive rotting attack exists).

## History

The elven dagger first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), upgrading a dagger or [great dagger](/wiki/Great_dagger "Great dagger") has a 1⁄2 chance of producing an elven dagger, and upgrading an elven dagger will produce a dagger or great dagger.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), elven daggers have a +4 to-hit bonus, and their weight is lowered to 3 [aum](/wiki/Aum "Aum"). Elven characters in roles that would start with daggers, [knives](/wiki/Knives "Knives") or [athames](/wiki/Athame "Athame") will instead start with elven daggers replacing each of them.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), an elven dagger can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining 2 [elven arrows](/wiki/Elven_arrow "Elven arrow") and a knife. Elven daggers can be used at a forge to create a few items:

- An elven dagger can be combined with 2 elven arrows to create an [elven spear](/wiki/Elven_spear "Elven spear").
- An elven dagger can be combined with 2 [crossbow bolts](/wiki/Crossbow_bolt "Crossbow bolt") to create an [elven short sword](/wiki/Elven_short_sword "Elven short sword").
- An elven dagger can be combined with a [small shield](/wiki/Small_shield "Small shield") to create an [elven shield](/wiki/Elven_shield "Elven shield").

### Hack'EM

In [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), upgrading a dagger will produce an elven dagger, and upgrading an elven dagger will produce a [stake](/wiki/Stake "Stake"). Forging recipes are the same as in EvilHack.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 826](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L826)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 114](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L114)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/u\_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 204](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/u_init.c#L204): *Race-based substitutions for initial inventory*
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 426](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L426): *default orcish weapons*
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 374](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L374)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 155](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L155): *1⁄2 to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds*
7. [↑](#cite_ref-7) [src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 229](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mplayer.c#L229)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Elven dagger

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
)
Name elven dagger
Appearance runed dagger
Damage vs. small 1d5
Damage vs. large 1d3
To-hit bonus +2
Weapon skill dagger
Size one-handed
Base price 4 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 10
Material wood

An elven dagger is a type of weapon that appears in NetHack. It uses the dagger skill, and like a dagger it can be used in melee and thrown as a projectile. It is made of wood, and appears as a runed dagger when unidentified.

Sting is an artifact elven dagger, and can be created by naming any elven dagger "Sting".

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 dNetHack
    • 4.3 EvilHack
    • 4.4 Hack'EM
  • 5 References

Generation

Player elves start the game with knowledge of the elven dagger.[1] Elven Rangers start each game with a +1 elven dagger as their secondary weapon.[2][3]

Elven daggers constitute 1.0% of randomly-generated weapons in the dungeon. In addition to random generation, weapon shops and general stores can stock elven daggers.

Live elves have a 1⁄2 chance of being generated with an elven dagger.[4] Hobbits have a 1⁄3 chance of generating with an elven dagger.[5]

Player monsters, including those on the Astral Plane, have a chance slightly higher than 1% of generating with an elven dagger as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.[6] Player monster rangers have a 1⁄2 chance of their initial weapon being made into an elven dagger.[7]

Strategy

Elven daggers are the best type of dagger available, but are somewhat harder to come by in comparison to normal daggers. A stack of elven daggers may be preferable to standard daggers, since they are only susceptible to rotting and fire damage - even this can be avoided by using a different weapon against the few monsters with fiery passive attacks (since no monster with a passive rotting attack exists).

History

The elven dagger first appears in NetHack 3.0.0.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, upgrading a dagger or great dagger has a 1⁄2 chance of producing an elven dagger, and upgrading an elven dagger will produce a dagger or great dagger.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, elven daggers have a +4 to-hit bonus, and their weight is lowered to 3 aum. Elven characters in roles that would start with daggers, knives or athames will instead start with elven daggers replacing each of them.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, an elven dagger can be created at a forge by combining 2 elven arrows and a knife. Elven daggers can be used at a forge to create a few items:

  • An elven dagger can be combined with 2 elven arrows to create an elven spear.
  • An elven dagger can be combined with 2 crossbow bolts to create an elven short sword.
  • An elven dagger can be combined with a small shield to create an elven shield.

Hack'EM

In Hack'EM, upgrading a dagger will produce an elven dagger, and upgrading an elven dagger will produce a stake. Forging recipes are the same as in EvilHack.

References

  1. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 826
  2. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 114
  3. ↑ src/u_init.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 204: Race-based substitutions for initial inventory
  4. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 426: default orcish weapons
  5. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 374
  6. ↑ src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 155: 1⁄2 to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds
  7. ↑ src/mplayer.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 229

An '''elven dagger''' is a type of [[weapon]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It uses the [[dagger]] [[skill]], and like a dagger it can be used in [[melee]] and [[thrown]] as a [[projectile]]. It is made of [[wood]], and appears as a '''runed dagger''' when [[identification|unidentified]].

[[Sting]] is an [[artifact weapon|artifact]] elven dagger, and can be created by [[naming]] any elven dagger "Sting".

==Generation==
Player [[Elf (starting race)|elves]] start the game with knowledge of the elven dagger.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|826|version=NetHack 3.6.7}} Elven [[Ranger]]s start each game with a +1 elven dagger as their secondary weapon.{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|114|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}{{refsrc|src/u_init.c|204|nethack=3.6.7|comment=Race-based substitutions for initial inventory}}

Elven daggers constitute 1.0% of randomly-generated weapons in the dungeon. In addition to random generation, weapon [[shop]]s and general stores can stock elven daggers.

Live [[Elf (monster attribute)|elves]] have a {{frac|2}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] an elven dagger.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|426|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment=default orcish weapons}} [[Hobbit]]s have a {{frac|3}} chance of generating with an elven dagger.{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|374|nethack=3.6.7}}

[[Player monster]]s, including those on the [[Astral Plane]], have a chance slightly higher than 1% of generating with an elven dagger as their initial weapon before role-based replacements.{{refsrc|src/mplayer.c|155|version=NetHack 3.6.7|comment={{frac|2}} to get a random weapon - the designated range of objects covers weapons from the spear to the bullwhip inclusively in objects.c, and uses normal generation odds}} Player monster [[Ranger (player monster)|rangers]] have a {{frac|2}} chance of their initial weapon being made into an elven dagger.{{refsrc|src/mplayer.c|229|version=NetHack 3.6.7}}

==Strategy==
Elven daggers are the best type of dagger available, but are somewhat harder to come by in comparison to normal daggers. A stack of elven daggers may be preferable to standard daggers, since they are only susceptible to rotting and fire damage - even this can be avoided by using a different weapon against the few monsters with fiery [[passive attack]]s (since no monster with a passive rotting attack exists).

==History==
The elven dagger first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]].

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], upgrading a dagger or [[great dagger]] has a {{frac|2}} chance of producing an elven dagger, and upgrading an elven dagger will produce a dagger or great dagger.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], elven daggers have a +4 to-hit bonus, and their weight is lowered to 3 [[aum]]. Elven characters in roles that would start with daggers, [[knives]] or [[athame]]s will instead start with elven daggers replacing each of them.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], an elven dagger can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining 2 [[elven arrow]]s and a knife. Elven daggers can be used at a forge to create a few items:

* An elven dagger can be combined with 2 elven arrows to create an [[elven spear]].
* An elven dagger can be combined with 2 [[crossbow bolt]]s to create an [[elven short sword]].
* An elven dagger can be combined with a [[small shield]] to create an [[elven shield]].

===Hack'EM===
In [[Hack'EM]], upgrading a dagger will produce an elven dagger, and upgrading an elven dagger will produce a [[stake]]. Forging recipes are the same as in EvilHack.
